subtasks: Drive tractor equipped with tillage implement towards the field.
Operate the tractor to till the soil.
Position the tractor to cover the entire field.
Ensure even tilling by adjusting the tractor's speed and direction.
Check the depth and texture of the tilled soil.
Attach seed drill to the tractor.
Load the seed drill with seeds.
Align the seed drill with the field edges.
Start the seed drill and drive the tractor along the field rows.
Monitor the seed drill's performance and adjust settings as needed.
Plant the seeds at the correct depth and spacing.
Attach fertilizer spreader to the tractor.
Load the spreader with the desired fertilizer.
Drive the tractor along the field, spreading the fertilizer uniformly.
Check the spread pattern and make adjustments.
Apply pesticides or other chemicals using a sprayer.
Calibrate the sprayer to deliver the correct amount of chemical.
Drive the tractor through the field, applying the chemicals to the crops.
Inspect irrigation pipes and valves for leaks or damage.
Turn on the irrigation system and check water flow.
Adjust irrigation timing based on weather conditions.
Monitor crop water needs and optimize irrigation schedules.
Attach harvesting equipment (e.g., combine) to the tractor.
Determine the optimal harvest time based on crop maturity.
Drive the combine through the field, cutting and threshing the crops.
Operate the combine to separate the grains from the straw.
Load the harvested grain into trucks or storage bins.
Disassemble the harvesting equipment for cleaning.
Brush off debris from the combine’s cylinders and screens.
Lubricate the moving parts of the equipment.
Store the cleaned equipment in a sheltered area.
Prepare the tractor for the next season by servicing it.
Check tires, replace worn parts, and ensure all components are functional.
Store the tractor and other unused equipment safely.
